Miles Sound System SDK 6.6h

AIL_set_stream_reverb_levels

The function AIL_set_stream_reverb_levels changes the simple reverb settings of a digital stream.

void AIL_set_stream_reverb_levels(
  HSTREAM stream,
  F32 dry_level,
  F32 wet_level
);

In Parameters

stream
indicates the stream whose reverb is to be set.
dry_level
specifies the level of the dry sound signal (the non-reverbed sound). The range is 0.0 for no output, 1.0 for full output.
wet_level
specifies the level of the wet sound signal (the reverberations). The range is 0.0 for no output, 1.0 for full output.

Discussion

This functions controls the reverb levels applied by the AIL_set_digital_master_reverb. Reverb requires CPU time to apply, but it's pretty minimal. You can monitor the CPU use with the AIL_digital_CPU_percent function.

You can use this function even if you haven't started playback yet.


Group: Digital Audio Streaming Services
Related Functions: AIL_digital_CPU_percent, AIL_set_digital_master_reverb, AIL_set_stream_volume_levels, AIL_set_stream_volume_pan, AIL_stream_reverb_levels, AIL_stream_volume_pan
Related Basic Types: F32, HSTREAM, void
